page_analysis.text_content:
2nd & 3rd floor equivalency

Areas higher than 17' and 26' above the first floor (that do not already count as floor area e.g., open atrium spaces and inaccessible attic spaces), count toward the gross floor area in the form of 2nd and 3rd floor equivalency regardless of the floor plan or usage of the space. Stairwells will be measured the same way that vaulted ceiling spaces are measured.

In the examples of Fig 12 below the highlighted areas count as follows:

Area A
• once as 1st floor,
• again as 2nd floor, and
• a third time as 3rd-floor equivalency

Area B
• once as 1st floor,
• again as 2nd-floor equivalency

Note: 200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency may be exempted where roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper (see "Height" section).

Fig 12 2nd & 3rd floor equivalency

visual_elements.description: Two side-by-side cross-sectional architectural diagrams of a building illustrating the measurement of floor area equivalency for 2nd and 3rd floors. Both diagrams show a pitched roof with labeled height markers at 17' and 26' above the first floor. Shaded areas labeled 'A' and 'B' indicate zones counted as 1st, 2nd, and 3rd floor equivalency. The diagrams highlight 'Inaccessible attic (or vaulted ceiling)' areas and stairwells. Arrows and dimension lines indicate widths of areas that count as 2nd-floor and 3rd-floor equivalency. The right diagram additionally labels a 'Vaulted ceiling space' within area B. Roof material and finished floor levels are marked as typical.
A grey shaded note box stating: 'Note: 200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency may be exempted where roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper (see "Height" section).'
visual_elements.location: Upper right quadrant of the page

technical_specifications.parameter: Height above first floor for equivalency counting

additional_notes: Page number 17 at bottom right corner.
No handwritten annotations or stamps detected.
Text and diagrams are clear and legible.
cross_references: Reference to 'Height' section for roof pitch exemption details.

qualifiers.text: Areas higher than 17' and 26' above the first floor (that do not already count as floor area e.g., open atrium spaces and inaccessible attic spaces)

conditions.text: Areas count toward the gross floor area in the form of 2nd and 3rd floor equivalency regardless of the floor plan or usage of the space
200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency may be exempted where roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper

logical_relationships.expression: IF roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper THEN 200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency may be exempted

execution_sequence.action: Determine if areas are higher than 17' and 26' above the first floor and do not already count as floor area
Apply 2nd and 3rd floor equivalency counting to qualifying areas
Check roof pitch to determine if 200 sf exemption applies
